description:
379x120s = 12.6 hours L
60x120s = 2 hours each R/G/B
All from B7
Total of 18.6 hours of integration time

C8 w/ 0.63x reducer | CEM40 | ASI1600MM-Pro | ZWO LRGB

The underlying data from the C8 benefitted from a few nights of good seeing.  Data is still a bit soft, but that's just what I get to live with for trying to push 0.63"/pixel in my skies. 

Processing was pretty standard overall

Preprocessing

* Calibration using WBPP
* SubframeSelector
* StarAlignment
* ImageIntegration
* Drizzle (2x, vark 1.5, dropshrink 0.7)

L Channel

A superlum was created by integrating R, G, B, and L using ImageIntegration with NoiseEvaluation for weighting.

* Crop
* DBE
* Deconvolution
* MMT for sharpening
* IntegerResample to bring back to original pre-drizzle resolution
* TGVDenoise
* MMTDenoise
* HistogramTransformation for stretch
* One round of DBE for some lingering gradients
* FastRotation for a more natural angle
* MMT for some final denoise

R/G/B Channels

* DynamicCrop
* DBE
* BackgroundNeutralization
* ColorCalibration
* IntegerResample to pre-drizzle size
* TGVDenoise
* MMTDenoise
* HistogramTransformation
* FastRotation
* LRGBCombination with L channel (Chrominance Denoise enabled)
* Invert + SCNR on stars to remove magenta artifacts
* Curves
* MLT for some final sharpening & denoise
title: M101 - The Pinwheel Galaxy
